Foreman how it supports key requirements

platform consists of two core components
first the cloud platform captures and
processes events and messages from
connected devices there are a set of
integrated services within the AWS cloud
that provide a secure entry point for
your incoming data through the IOT
gateway and a channel for them feeding
that data into a number of tools to
enable inside transformation and rules
or actions inside the IOT service our
core functions to handle critical
components such as a device registry to
ensure every IOT device that connects to
the service is a trusted known device
with a pre shared key all inbound
connections of the service are sent over
secure encrypted channels using SSL and
TLS we also support a concept called
device shadows this service maintains a
known state of your devices in the event
of a network disconnection or service
interruption this enables you to write
applications and services that can
communicate in interact with devices
regardless of connection state this
greatly simplifies the coding effort and
takes away some of that heavy lifting

these kinds of IOT services lastly on
the cloud side we have the rules engine
a complex logic processor that allows

false
connecting to the cloud platform we have
